Articles.Content:
For this challenge, you take any ship and get it to to at least 20 gs for 20 seconds.

HARD MODE

Take it to 30 gs

SUPER MODE

Impress me

Edited June 27, 2017 by COB Gaming

Sorry, i meant 1,000. lmao

Edited June 26, 2017 by COB Gaming

Any space plane that reach orbit would exceed 2000m/s.  So basically, your challenge could be renamed to "build a spaceplane then take it to Laythe".
This has been done many, many times and there are plenty of similar challenges around.

31 minutes ago, wibou7 said:

Any space plane that reach orbit would exceed 2000m/s.  So basically, your challenge could be renamed to "build a spaceplane then take it to Laythe".
This has been done many, many times and there are plenty of similar challenges around.

No, you don't get it. Reach 2000 m/s while still in the atmosphere.

55 minutes ago, COB Gaming said:

No, you don't get it. Reach 2000 m/s while still in the atmosphere.

...still not a meaningful challenge, I'm afraid. Most of my KSP launch vehicles are pushing 2 km/s well before they leave the atmosphere.

let's make it more interesting, for fun, and to suppress the challenge submission guide.

 

how about you throw in that it hast to be able to experience at least 10 g's for at least 1 minute in one way or another, like that roller coaster of death.

Edited June 26, 2017 by rockets-don't-make-toast

I take exception to the recording rule.  Some of us have potatoes computers that can't handle KSP and recording software at the same time and asking for video proof just excludes us.  Other than that, I agree, this challenge is an easy one.  Perhaps if there was an altitude cap it might make for a more difficult challenge.

18 hours ago, COB Gaming said:

No, you don't get it. Reach 2000 m/s while still in the atmosphere.

Most spaceplanes reach orbital speeds while still in the upper atmosphere... So yeah this is "just" build a spaceplane and fly it to laythe challenge.

That said it can be fun and challenging if you havent done it before but there have been several challenges for this already...
